pageContext.claim: “Now, the lawyer that went to the meeting, I see that she was in the halls of Congress also. Somebody said that her visa or her passport, to come into the country, was approved by Attorney General Lynch.”
pageContext.analysis: Natalia Veselnitskaya was granted special immigration parole from October 2015 to early January 2016 for a limited purpose -- to help in the defense of a Russian company that was involved in a Justice Department asset forfeiture case. It is unclear why she was still in the U.S. after that temporary parole expired.
